head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #19

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #19 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: neuve by Sturgeon lake. The Guide informs me that the river which descends [from] Sturgeon lake, falls also into this lake, but does not think we should have arrive[d] here so soon, had we taken the other road; he says it is one River all the way, & is calld by the Canadians Rivière de chemin neuve, & by the Inds Pishu a Sepy. I put much confidence in what this man says, as he has been brought up among the Canadians & seems very fond of them, he is an excellent Guide & good hunter, & in a word the very reverse of our former Guide, he being the most villainous, & thi[s] the best Indian that ever I met with[.] I am induc'd to make this digression at the end of the day, in favour of a man, whom Providence has put in our way for had it not been for him when we arriv'd in Sturgeon lake, the fruits of the voyage must have been lost, & we probably perish'd for want of Provisions.

July 14 Wednesday. From the rapid à la Loutre WbN3½ to a narrow Channel between 2 Islands, lac des Truits which appears like a river on the Lt – 1 Isld 2 bays, & river mentd yesterday on Rt which Riv. passing the Point of a bay bore NbE. [T]he Channel mentd in last Co has sevl Stones in it, which makes it very narrow & oblig'd us to pass rod the Island on Rt – from it W2m to a pt of Stones on Rt the pt of an Id opposite distant abt 80yds – turn'd rod the pt on Rt & went NWbN2m. to a pt on Lt deep bay & sevl Is on Rt 1 Isld on Lt – turn'd rod ye pt on Lt & went NWbW3m. to the pt of an Isld in the middle of the Channel passing 1 bay on Lt & 3 bays & 1 Isld on Rt – then NWbN2½ to an openg like a Strait between 2 Is sevl bays & 2 Iss on Lt & sevl small bays on Rt & one deep one from the Pt on the Rt side of the Strait – across a small bay on Lt to a rocky pt NWbN¾ turnd rod ye pt & went in a broad bay ¾ to a pt on Lt – same Co across a small bay ½m. to a pt on Lt – then WSW. to the mo of Riv. de lac Seul ¾ – deep bay & 2 Isds on Lt – from the mo of the Riv. 1½ to a Rapid near ¼m. long & difficul[t] debark'd all but 3, after passing the Canoe Port. Shatake, on Rt side & 156yds over a good road, from the end of the Port. WSW1½ – then 2m – when the river appears to be divided into 2 branches, went down the right hand one (the other is a lac & called by the Inds Tête de Francois, & bore from the middle of the Chanl Wt) NNE1m. then turnd upon the Rt NE2m. to a pt on Lt – rod ye pt ¼ – when it opens into a small lac – cross'd it from the pt of 1st island NNW2m. (pass'd 3 Islands & bay on Lt & 3 bays & 1 isld on Rt) to the Riv. rocky on both sides, in it 5m. to a wide Channel, in the middle of which is a large Id of Pine Trees & a long view in a Strait line abt 5 Leagues, pass'd between the island & the ma[in] on the Lt shore, from wch to 1st pt of the Id ½m. Isld ¾m. long, from the lower end of it EbN2½ to a broad Channel on Lt leaving the main branch beh[d] us – went in it NWbW¾ to a narrow channel on Lt – the channel leads i[n]to a lac, turn'd ye pt on Lt & went ¾m. WNW. to the pt of an Id on Lt leav[g] a deep narrow opening on Lt – then WbS½ to a stony pt on Rt deep bay on Lt – then NWbW along No shore ¾ – then left ye lac & entd ye River NbW½ – then 1m. to a rapid, shot it with ease having plenty of water – then a small lac in wch ¼ to 1st pt on Lt – turn'd ye pt which is rocky – then 100yds to a pt of Grass, went along it 1m. & then the Riv. pass'd a deep bay & 2 Is on Rt went 2m. to the end of the Grass on Lt shore then WbS3½ in a broad Channel

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
